comments:
Using Eclipse 3.2RC4

Try renaming a file (say build.properties) in the Package Explorer.  Enter " " as the new name.  You will get an error message saying that that is an invalid name.  Then hit Cancel in the rename file dialog.  You will get an invalid error message.

Reproduced in RC7.

Log entry is written.

We should also improve the error message to use quotes:
' ' is not a valid name..

*** Bug 146110 has been marked as a duplicate of this bug. ***
Filed bug 147075 for quoting of name in error message.
*** Bug 149917 has been marked as a duplicate of this bug. ***
Reopening. This did not happen in 3.1.2 -- might want to fix regression for 3.2.1.

Created an attachment (id=46512)
Simple Fix

In 3.1.2, selection restoration did not work at all. In 3.2, it works if the refactoring was successfully executed, but throws an NPE if the rename refactoring failed or was canceled with an inexistent name in the dialog.

This is a simple fix for the 3.2.1 branch. The full fix would require a lot more changes and to also fix very contrived situations (when the user types in an existing name and then clicks cancel).
*** Bug 152960 has been marked as a duplicate of this bug. ***
